channel.title: Guys I Have had my server on server status it said online now it isnt!
channel.description: I think its my cleint ips as they are all my no-ip i wouldn't call myself a coder so this is where am struggling i have thought this cant be right as my protforward i used the ip there which is differant from my no-ip so im wondering where every ip goes if anyone could take a look id rep++ and give them admin spot on my server

item.title: Guys I Have had my server on server status it said online now it isnt!
item.dc:creator: @mitch639 mitch639
item.description:
@mitch639 wrote:

Make your Ip-Adress static.

Go to Control Panel > Network & Internet Settings > Your Network > Change your Adapter Settings > Make custom Configuration.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Thanks Thanks

@Thanks wrote:

Your ip is going to change unless it’s static just change it to where you portforwarded before. If you have utorrent up or other torrent programs they can mess it up.

item.title: Guys I Have had my server on server status it said online now it isnt!
item.dc:creator: @Storm_Powner Storm Powner
item.description:
@Storm_Powner wrote:

in your router you put your computers ip, the static one. in no-ip you put your external ip (www.whatismyip.org) place the no-ip in you client and server. and you’re done.

btw to connect yourself while hosting make your client’s ip 127.0.0.1 or you can’t connect.

Read full topic
